intro: Poterium polygamum var. platylophum, commonly known as the broad-lobed potterscale, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually broad and fleshy, with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The flowers, which bloom in shades of yellow and orange, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
